description:
we all hang in a Zoom session and share a 🍹
Zoom Link will be provided in the livestream!

title: SAP Support Message Reporting with CAP
description: Replicate data from SAP Support Launchpad Incident OData service for local reporting.

speakers.bio: Freelance Solution Architect, SAP Developer & Consultant

title: Use CAP (Node.js) with other databases than SAP HANA
description:
CAP is trying to avoid hardwired lock-ins through higher-level concepts and APIs, but the out-of-the-box support is heavily focussing on SAP's own tools and technologies. So in terms of databases, SAP HANA currently is the only out-of-the-box supported database for running CAP apps in production scenarios. 
Due to the modular concepts, CAP offers an abstraction layer for database adapters. By using this layer, it is possible to add support for other relational and even non-relational databases. But since there is no out-of-the-box solution provided by SAP, those database adapters need to be implemented by others.
In this talk I will give an overview of the current state of the database abstraction layer (from a non CAP core developer perspective) and present the Open Source PostgresSQL adapter (cds-pg) implemented by members of the SAP Community. I will also give some insights into the development process, which may help you to either implement your own CAP database adapter or to participate in the further development of cds-pg.

speakers.bio:
Seven years ago I decided to move into the SAP ecosystem and since then I made myself a home in the area around the SAP Business Technology Platform. That's also where I became a big fan of the Cloud Application Programming Model and joined the community efforts to bring CAP closer to the Open Source world. I am a contributor to the PostgreSQL adapter for CAP (cds-pg) and maintainer of the supportive database schema evolution library (cds-dbm).
Outside of the SAP ecosystem, I spend most of my time with my beautiful wife and our three wonderful kids.

title: Enabling collaboration in sales processes - SAP meets Microsoft
description: We will show you our solution to automate the provisioning of a Microsoft Office 365 environment to support the collaboration between Sales and Engineering people during the creation of a Sales Quote. The solution was built during a Hack2Build event and covers SAP Sales Cloud, S/4HANA, various services on SAP BTP and MS Graph APIs for Teams and SharePoint.

speakers.bio: Senior Solution Architect at IBsolution GmbH for topics like SAP BTP Extension Suite and SAP HANA.

title: Star Wars API rewritten in CAP
description:
Late last year I decided to look at the open source Star Wars API that had fallen out of maintenance and rewrite this project in SAP Cloud Application Programming Model. What started as a holiday season fun diversion turned out to be a rather robust opportunity to explore the extreme edges of CAP capabilities.  In this session I'd like to share and highlight the findings from this conversion project from Python to CAP. This will include bi-directional, many-to-many relationship modeling, bulk loading of data via CAP CQL, and annotations for semantic keys and value help. And it's all Star Wars based so we will have some fun along the way. 
https://github.com/SAP-samples/cloud-cap-hana-swapi/

speakers.bio: Head of SAP Developer Advocacy team. Coder, speaker, troublemaker. Views and comments are my own, not SAP's.

title: CAP outside SAP
description: CAP and its components are tightly tailored to work with SAP BTP. Yet, the overall programming model, concepts and the components are open. In this presentation I will guide attendees through the steps to have a CAP solution running on a non-SAP K8s infrastructure. I'll show how to get CAP with PostgreSQL as database running on OpenShift. I'll discuss the pros and problems that come with this approach, like: single pod or HA, authentication, scaling. For everyone to be able to redo the examples, I'll use RedHat CodeReady Containers as the platform.

speakers.bio: Working with SAP mainly in the UX area, covering everything from Fiori, UI5, mobile, portal to cloud. Acting mostly in the space where SAP meets non-SAP areas in a company. This gives some unique views on SAP and what customers need and what the challenges are. I travel between the worlds of coders and architects, making me an expert in none. Solving way too many basis and security problems.
speakers.funFact: Founder of SAP Stammtisch Baden. I have 23 years of ABAP experience.

title: Taking CAP to the next level – with TypeScript
description:
TypeScript has become an essential part of modern development with Node.js. Not only does TypeScript provide better code completion, but its strong typing also prevents runtime errors.
Two tools have been developed by the CAP community that enable the use of TypeScript in CAP projects and support development. This session shows cds2types and cds-routing-handlers.

speakers.bio: I am working as a lead devloper and architect on a SaaS platform on the BTP consisting of several individual services and products and am one of the co-initiators of cds2types and cds-routing-handlers.
Software engineer and passionate gamer, trying to fuse both obsessions together to create a better future!

title: Usability and reusability with CAP
description:
Thanks to the modular nature of CAP, more complex environments can be abstracted out and reused. This can be done by importing an existing EDMX file so an existing service can be called, but much more interesting is the idea if importing a CAP project as a dependency. Database entities or services can be augmented, added to or changed without losing the integrity of the existing tables and services. Service implementations can be shared or ignored. 

Find out what works and doesn't work when reusing an existing entity in this 20 minute session

speakers.bio:
Hello 👋

My name is Jorg and I've been working in SAP and web land for nearly 15 years. What I like is software development which I do whenever family life lets me. What I care about is efficient and performance code, which is why I was looking into reusability in the first place
speakers.funFact: Fun-weird fact: I can dislocate my thumbs.

title: Orchestration of micro-frontends with Luigi, Azure AD, CAP & UI5
description:
In this session we will demo our application build with Luigi, CAP, Azure AD and SAPUI5.

We will show how to use Luigi, an orchestration framework to implement micro frontends. You will learn how to use Azure Active Directory for authentication, SAP cloud application programming model (CAP) for the development of backend service with authorization and UI5 as frontend technology. 

Gain understanding on how to secure your application and services with authentication and authorization.

speakers.bio: Senior Consultant with more than 15 years of experience with SAP Solutions. Always looking for innovations and new technologies to use in and around the SAP universe. If there is something new I want to try it out and build some demo's with it :-)
Consultant with 7 years of experience with different technologies and domains in IT/Software industry. A beginner in SAP ecosystem. I would like to define myself as ‘Jack of all, master of none’.
speakers.funFact: Love to travel, have been to around 15 countries.

title: Messaging and Service Consumption
description:
In this live coding demo we will show, how to use CAP service consumption and messaging in a grow-as-you-go
fashion, to quickly iterate on extending the well-known CAP bookshop sample. We will import the API of a remote SAP S/4HANA service, first mock, then call the service, extend the bookshop to reference remote entities, do partial replication of them, and keep them up to date by subscribing and acting on change events sent by the remote system.

speakers.bio: David Kunz is one of the core developers for the Node.js runtime of the SAP Cloud Application Programming Model.   After finishing his PhD in theoretical particle physics, David followed his vocation for programming. He is always striving to gain comprehensive knowledge of emerging technologies and advocates for superior paradigms and tools for efficient development.

title: Schema Evolution and Tools
description:
See our improvements for schema evolution on SAP HANA in action.
Learn how you can build custom build tasks.
Get excited about CDS Linting.

speakers.bio: Working as PO, cook and bottle washer in the CAP tools team.
Working at SAP for quite some time in various software development areas - mostly tool and framework related :). Now, a member of the CAP Tools Team.
